thread.title: Man receives phone call, steps outside, gets shot, Matteson police say Daily Southtown
thread.title_full: Man receives phone call, steps outside, gets shot, Matteson police say - Daily Southtown

author: Dennis Sullivan
title: Man receives phone call, steps outside, gets shot, Matteson police say Daily Southtown
text:
A 40-year-old man was in critical condition Friday morning following a drive-by shooting Thursday evening in south suburban Matteson.
Police Chief Michael Jones said the victim was shot four times about 9:30 p.m. in the 4100 block of Lindenwood Drive. He was transported to Advocate Christ Hospital in Oak Lawn.
The scene of the shooting is a few blocks north of the intersection of Lincoln and Governors highways.
Jones, in a prepared statement, said witnesses told police the man was visiting his girlfriend when he stepped outside after receiving a telephone call. A black SUV reportedly left the scene going west immediately after the shooting.
Jones said a police officer in the vicinity heard 10-15 shots and immediately headed to the scene to find the victim "stumbling towards the front" of a home before collapsing.
Investigators recovered 10-15 spent shell casings "strewn around the street."
The South Suburban Major Crimes Task Force is assisting with the investigation.
Anyone with information is asked to call (708) 503-3130.
Dennis Sullivan is a freelance reporter.
